But it is not always the case that There is nothing new under the sun. Economic globalization in the 19th century was qualitatively different from what had come in preceding centuries, e.g., in the Age of Exploration. ORourke and Williamson (1999) show that by the relevant economic criteria the big bang of globalization is properly dated in the 19th century.
Frankel and Romer (1999).
